normal.statement: Which of the following is the most abundant cellular component of blood?
What percentage of blood is composed of plasma?
Which plasma protein is primarily involved in blood clotting?
What is the average life span of red blood cells in humans?
Which organ is known as the 'graveyard of RBCs'?
Which type of white blood cells are most abundant in human blood?
What is the normal range of platelets per mm³ of blood?
Which blood group is called the 'universal donor'?
Which blood group is called the 'universal recipient'?
What percentage of humans are Rh positive?
Which enzyme converts fibrinogen to fibrin during blood clotting?
What is the fluid collected by the lymphatic system called?
Which type of circulatory system is present in arthropods and molluscs?
How many chambers does a fish heart have?
Which animals have a four-chambered heart?
Where is the human heart located?
What is the protective membrane surrounding the heart called?
Which valve guards the opening between the right atrium and right ventricle?
What is the normal heart rate in a healthy adult?
Which part of the heart is known as the pacemaker?
What does the P-wave in an ECG represent?
Which circulation carries blood between the heart and lungs?
What is the term for high blood pressure?
Which disease is characterized by narrowing of arteries due to fatty deposits?
What is the volume of blood pumped by each ventricle per minute called?

moderate.statement: If a person has anti-A antibodies in their plasma, what is their blood group?
Which ion plays a crucial role in the blood clotting process?
What would happen if the SA node stops functioning?
options: AV node will take over as pacemaker
moderate.answer: AV node will take over as pacemaker

moderate.statement: During ventricular systole, which valves are closed?
Which component of blood is responsible for immune responses?
What is the condition called when a Rh-negative mother carries a Rh-positive fetus?
Which blood cells are responsible for allergic reactions?
What is the function of the hepatic portal system?
options: Carry blood from liver to heart
Carry blood from intestine to liver
Carry blood from liver to intestine
Carry blood from heart to liver
moderate.answer: Carry blood from intestine to liver

moderate.statement: Which part of the heart has the thickest muscular wall?
What is the duration of one cardiac cycle if heart rate is 75 beats per minute?
Which wave in ECG represents repolarization of ventricles?
What is the average stroke volume of blood pumped by each ventricle per beat?
Which type of WBCs are involved in phagocytosis?
What is the normal hemoglobin content in 100 mL of blood in a healthy individual?
Which blood cells are produced from megakaryocytes?
What is the function of albumin in plasma?
Which blood vessels have valves to prevent backflow of blood?
What is the first heart sound (lub) associated with?
options: Opening of tricuspid and bicuspid valves
Closure of tricuspid and bicuspid valves
moderate.answer: Closure of tricuspid and bicuspid valves

moderate.statement: Which system moderates the heart function through autonomic nervous system?
What is the main difference between serum and plasma?
Which type of circulation is found in amphibians?
What is the function of chordae tendineae in the heart?
options: Anchor AV valves to ventricular walls
moderate.answer: Anchor AV valves to ventricular walls

moderate.statement: Which blood cells lack nucleus in mammals?
What is the normal range of WBCs per mm³ of blood?
Which hormone can increase cardiac output?

hard.statement: In the ABO blood grouping system, what would be the genotype of a person with blood group O?
During the cardiac cycle, when are all four chambers of the heart in diastole?
Which of the following statements about the conduction system of the heart is incorrect?
options: AV node is located in the right atrium
Bundle of His conducts impulses from atria to ventricles
Purkinje fibers are found in the atria
SA node generates maximum action potentials
hard.answer: Purkinje fibers are found in the atria

hard.statement: What would be the cardiac output of a person with heart rate of 80 beats/minute and stroke volume of 60 mL?
Which of the following is not a function of lymph?
In the coagulation cascade, what is the role of thrombokinase?
Which of the following WBCs is not phagocytic?
What is the significance of the biconcave shape of RBCs?
options: Increases surface area for gas exchange

hard.statement: Which chamber of the heart receives deoxygenated blood from the body?
What is the correct pathway of blood flow through the heart?
options: Right ventricle → Right atrium → Pulmonary vein → Lungs → Pulmonary artery → Left atrium → Left ventricle → Aorta
Left atrium → Left ventricle → Pulmonary artery → Lungs → Pulmonary vein → Right atrium → Right ventricle → Aorta
Right atrium → Right ventricle → Pulmonary artery → Lungs → Pulmonary vein → Left atrium → Left ventricle → Aorta
Right atrium → Left atrium → Pulmonary artery → Lungs → Pulmonary vein → Right ventricle → Left ventricle → Aorta
hard.answer: Right atrium → Right ventricle → Pulmonary artery → Lungs → Pulmonary vein → Left atrium → Left ventricle → Aorta

hard.statement: Which of the following is not a difference between arteries and veins?
options: Arteries have thicker walls than veins
Arteries carry oxygenated blood, veins carry deoxygenated blood
Arteries have smaller lumen than veins
Arteries have no valves, veins have valves
hard.answer: Arteries carry oxygenated blood, veins carry deoxygenated blood

hard.statement: What is the role of the semilunar valves?
options: Prevent backflow of blood from atria to ventricles
Prevent backflow of blood from ventricles to atria
Prevent backflow of blood from veins to atria
Prevent backflow of blood from arteries to ventricles
hard.answer: Prevent backflow of blood from arteries to ventricles

hard.statement: Which of the following is not a formed element of blood?
What is the function of the coronary circulation?
options: Supply blood to the digestive system
Supply blood to the heart muscle
hard.answer: Supply blood to the heart muscle

hard.statement: Which of the following statements about blood groups is correct?
options: Rh negative person has Rh antigens on RBCs
Group AB has both A and B antigens on RBCs
Group A can receive blood from group B
Group O has both A and B antibodies in plasma
hard.answer: Group AB has both A and B antigens on RBCs

hard.statement: What is the role of the atrioventricular node (AV node)?
Which of the following is not a granulocyte?
What is the significance of the hepatic portal system?
options: Filters blood through liver before systemic circulation
Directly delivers absorbed nutrients to heart
hard.answer: Filters blood through liver before systemic circulation

hard.statement: Which of the following is not a feature of open circulatory system?
What is the function of the Purkinje fibers?
Which of the following is not a component of plasma?
What is the role of the sympathetic nervous system on heart function?
options: Has no effect on heart rate

hard.statement: Which of the following is not a difference between blood and lymph?
options: Blood has more proteins than lymph
Blood flows in blood vessels, lymph in lymph vessels
Blood is colorless, lymph is red
hard.answer: Blood is colorless, lymph is red

hard.statement: What is the significance of the QRS complex in ECG?
Which of the following is not a disorder of circulatory system?

neet.statement: A person with blood group AB requires blood transfusion. Which blood group(s) can donate blood to this person?
In a standard ECG, which one of the following represents the depolarization of atria?
Which of the following statements is correct regarding erythroblastosis fetalis?
options: It occurs when father is Rh+ and mother is Rh-
It occurs when father is Rh- and mother is Rh+
It occurs when both father and mother are Rh+
It occurs when both father and mother are Rh-
neet.answer: It occurs when father is Rh+ and mother is Rh-

neet.statement: The QRS complex in a standard ECG represents:
Which of the following is a non-phagocytic white blood cell?
Blood analysis of a patient reveals a high count of eosinophils. This could indicate:
Which of the following events occurs during joint diastole?
options: Blood is pumped out of ventricles
